Bug.Summery: Cannot run manual testcases
Bug.WithStack:
I am using TPTP 4.2 TPTP-4.1.0-200511160100 containing the fix checked in by Scott for the RAc configuration
I am trying to run a manual testcase ( any from the o.e.h.usecases plugin ) but the execution history is automatically generated with no events; the swt application is not opened.
Please reroute if necassary; we need to do a drop to IES by this Friday and this should be fixed by then so we can have a smoke test run on the candidate driver This is working as designed in TPTP v4.1 so retargetting to TPTP v4.2.
Cannot ship without this enhancement Prevents function from being used, no work around This problem is found in the following two scenarios:
Agent Controller: A 'java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/jface/viewers/ISelection' exception is thrown since the version number of the <Agent Controller installation direcotry>\plugins\org.eclipse.jface_3.1.0.jar has changed versions (3.1.0 --> 3.2.0). To solve this problem the org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.config.SetConfig.java class in the org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller plugin should generate the serviceconfig.xml referencing the correct JAR. The same fix is required for the following JARs packaged with the Agent Controller:
org.eclipse.emf.common_2.1.0.jar org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.1.0.jar org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi_2.1.0.jar org.eclipse.core.commands_3.1.0.jar
IAC: A java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Layout' exception is thrown since the name of <Eclipse installation direcotry>\plugins\org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.jar has changed names (org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.jar --> org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.v3212.jar). To solve this problem the org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.hyades.config.ConfigurationLo ader class in the org.eclipse.hyades.execution plug-in should generate the serviceconfig.xml referencing the correct JAR. Fixes (see comment #2) checked into HEAD (TPTP 4.2).
Note, defect https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=116719 was opened to confirm that this JAR file name change was intentional and permanent. verified with TPTP-4.2.0-200511161545 closing

Bug.Summery: Bad Class Cast in IDEReportEditor.java

source_code.code: //The java file is outside of a project and or workspace returns
/** * Editor input for report designer. It's based on non-project concept, and uses * java.io.File directly as its storage. */

Lines.Line: 1. Doesn't install org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide plug-in. This plug-in include the editor to open workspace based files.
2. Installs org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp plug-in. This plug-in include the editor to open out of workspace files.
3. Open the editor with following sample code.

Bug.WithStack: So I'm trying to open a report with BIRT/Eclipse API using the BIRT 2.0 nightly build code (as of 11/16/2005). the file IDEReportEditor.java method private IFile getFile( IEditorInput input ) { return ( (ReportFileEditorInput) input ).getFile( ); } However, input can be ReportEditorInput which is also an IEditorInput (to support reports found outside projects and workspaces) which doesn't even have a getFile() method on it. This causes a deeply nested exception that causes the report desinger to not be able to show a report that might be physically located outside a workspace. Just to add to this so if I want to write api like //The java file is outside of a project and or workspace returns IEditorInput input= new ReportEditorInput(file); //this returns "org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.editors.ReportEditor" String editorId= getEditorId(file); ... final IWorkbenchPage activePage= window.getActivePage(); try { //now open the editor (This blows up) activePage.openEditor(input, editorId); Because of the cast problem I mentioned above Becuase IDEEditor support resouce tracker and other feature, the input must be a instance of ReportFileEditorInput. With this class, we can get IFile with in workspace resouce management feature. If you want to open a file is not in workspace, you need to use RCPEditor that support open external workspec file. Verified in build 20051125. Still need help here... I have looked at this again I see an RCPReportEditor but all the methods are protected. Can you give me an example of how to load a report outside the workspace. I have a path to a file and I want to load it in the BIRT report designer. Thanks. ok I'm a bit more puzzled by this. If I look at ReportEditorInput, it says /** * Editor input for report designer. It's based on non-project concept, and uses * java.io.File directly as its storage. */ and this class implements IReportEditorInput which extends IPathEditorInput which extends IEditorInput So... if a class implements a particular interface and you have API that uses this interface. Shouldn't it be supported? Furthermore, the comment of the class says that it supports what I was trying to do. So something is wrong here. finally, can you give me an example of how to load a non workspace and non project report into the report designer. my queries in my dev environment leave me with no solution so far. Thanks for any clarifications and solutions. Reoprnt this bug with new comments from commiter. I just tried this in 2.0M3 and its still broke can the priority of fix for this be bumped up. Also will there be a way to do this with out installing the entire RCP plug-ins, seems a common thing to do, without having the additional overhead of installing x more number of plug-ins. Please try following steps. Wish this can help you. Any more question, please don't hesitate to let me know. 1. Doesn't install org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide plug-in. This plug-in include the editor to open workspace based files. 2. Installs org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp plug-in. This plug-in include the editor to open out of workspace files. 3. Open the editor with following sample code. final IWorkbench workbench = PlatformUI.getWorkbench( ); IWorkbenchWindow window = workbench.getActiveWorkbenchWindow( ); if ( window != null ) { try { IEditorPart editor = window .getActivePage( ) .openEditor( new ReportEditorInput( new File( "c:\\new_report_45.rptdesign" ) ), "org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.editors.ReportEditor" ); // Editor // ID if ( editor instanceof ReportEditor ) { int previewIndex = ( (ReportEditor) editor ) .getPreviewPageIndex( ); ( (ReportEditor) editor ).setActivePage( previewIndex ); } } catch ( PartInitException e ) { e.printStackTrace( ); } } } Created attachment 31889 shows the error I am seeing when I try to run the proposed solution code Shows the error I am seeing when I try to run the proposed solution code This solution doesn't seem to work (at least not using the 2.0M3 bits). See the exception below. I have the following plug-ins in my environment org.eclipse.ui, org.eclipse.ui.editors, org.eclipse.ui.ide, org.eclipse.birt.core, org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp, org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui when I run the suggested code, I get the following exception: java.lang.ClassCastException at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.editors.IDEReportEditor.getFile(IDEReportEditor.java:369) at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.editors.IDEReportEditor.superSetInput(IDEReportEditor.java:254) at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.editors.parts.AbstractMultiPageLayoutEditor.init(AbstractMultiPageLayoutEditor.java:717) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.createSite(EditorManager.java:778) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.createPartHelper(EditorReference.java:596) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorReference.createPart(EditorReference.java:384) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPartReference.getPart(WorkbenchPartReference.java:552) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartPane.setVisible(PartPane.java:283) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.presentations.PresentablePart.setVisible(PresentablePart.java:126) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.presentations.util.PresentablePartFolder.select(PresentablePartFolder.java:268) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.presentations.util.LeftToRightTabOrder.select(LeftToRightTabOrder.java:65) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.presentations.util.TabbedStackPresentation.selectPart(TabbedStackPresentation.java:391) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.refreshPresentationSelection(PartStack.java:1102) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.setSelection(PartStack.java:1051) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.showPart(PartStack.java:1256) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.add(PartStack.java:442) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorStack.add(EditorStack.java:109) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorSashContainer.addEditor(EditorSashContainer.java:60) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorAreaHelper.addToLayout(EditorAreaHelper.java:212) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorAreaHelper.addEditor(EditorAreaHelper.java:202) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.createEditorTab(EditorManager.java:758) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.openEditorFromDescriptor(EditorManager.java:665) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.openEditor(EditorManager.java:628) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.busyOpenEditorBatched(WorkbenchPage.java:2360) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.busyOpenEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:2295) additional debug info when I get to the solution code line if (editor instanceof ReportEditor) the editor is a ErrorEditorPart Object Created attachment 31890 Another picture with exception information showing Did you remove the IDE plugin in? If you already remove the IDE plug-in, please try to clear up the work space. Looks the code still open the file with IDE editor instead of RCP editor to get the error. Please provide more infor of you requiement. I can open a external file following the steps in comments#8. Please notify the IDE plugin and RCP plugin can not work together. "Please notify the IDE plugin and RCP plugin can not work together." That is most likely the problem. So our application will be running as part of the eclipse IDE. Our requirement is that we will have reports that live outside the IDE workspace and project structure, and so we need to be able to load, these reports into the report designer. If I understand correctly, in this case, I can't replace the IDE plugin with the RCP plugin because we are in the IDE. Can we get an IDE API that allows the loading of reports from outside the workspace? Any other workarounds you all can suggest? As i tested, the BIRT RCP plugin can work under eclipe ide enviroment. Do you need specail feature of BIRT IDE plug-in. The main different is BIRT RCP editor don't support eclipe navigator ,workspace and project concept. All file are accessed directly from file system. The BIRT IDE editor support eclipe navigator and alos the workspace and project concept. Can you use RCP editor only? The main feature of BIRT are there with BIRT RCP plugin. What you need to do is remove org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide plug-in from plugins directory and install org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp plug-in in plugins directory. Another work around can be write your own editor by extends from ReportEditor. You need write your own implmementation of interface IReportEditorInput to handle the case of opening external files. Please refer to RCP plugin codes. It's quite easy to do that because there're only a few codes in RCP editor and ReportEditoInput classes. Verified in build 20051226. So I have dug into this extensively using the provided suggestion to implement my own classes. So...on this advice I have implemented my own derived class that implements IReportEditorInput, I have also created my own derived class that implments from ReportEditor. But things still aren't working well. What I want to do,is in the Eclipse IDE, open the eclipse Report design perspective and load my report template into this perspective. currently I do: IWorkbench WB = PlatformUI.getWorkbench(); ... WB.showPerspective(ConfigurationStrings.BIRT_REPORT_PERSPECTIVE_ID,window); ... IEditorRegistry editorRegistry= WB.getEditorRegistry(); IEditorDescriptor descriptor= editorRegistry.getDefaultEditor(file.getName()); editorID = descriptor.getId(); ... activePage.openEditor(input, editorId); So.....is there a easy way to say, use the birt report design perspective but use my (specially created) report editor? Thanks Currently, BIRT can't open report design outside of workspace in IDE enviroment, but can in RCP enviroment. So, if you want to open external report design in your, you may reference to what RCP do. Because plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp and plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide can't work togther, so if you use plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide in your application, you must define a new editor to open external report design, just simply copy from report editor in plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp. I have made a crack patch for plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide which add an editor 'org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide.externalReportEditor', you can open a external report design like PlatformUI.getWorkbench( ).getActivePage( ).openEditor(new ExternalReportEditorInput(new File("D:/test.rptdesign")),"org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide.externalReportEditor"); Hope it help. Created attachment 32898 patch for plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide (In reply to comment #21) > Created an attachment (id=32898) [edit] > patch for plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide > Thanks for the help guys, however, I'm not familiar with this .patch file concept, how is this used? check out the project org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide from eclipse cvs, then aplly patch for this project use the .patch file. Is it possible to enhancement plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp co-exist with plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide OR enhance plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide to open a report dsign that is not in the project? This will allow other IDE based app to embed BIRT report designer. change to enhancement and schedule for 2.1 consideration. Yes I agree that these plug-ins need to live in harmony, would be good to get this fixed for 2.1. Also wanted to Thank Birt developers/team for the patch file, I have encorporated this and it allows me to load files outside the workspace using the IDE plug-in for the time being. However, its still our hopes to see an official long term fix in 2.1. Support report files out of workspace now.

I have the following plug-ins in my environment org.eclipse.ui, org.eclipse.ui.editors, org.eclipse.ui.ide, org.eclipse.birt.core, org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp, org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui when I run the suggested code, I get the following exception: additional debug info when I get to the solution code line if (editor instanceof ReportEditor) the editor is a ErrorEditorPart Object Created attachment 31890 Another picture with exception information showing Did you remove the IDE plugin in? If you already remove the IDE plug-in, please try to clear up the work space. Looks the code still open the file with IDE editor instead of RCP editor to get the error. Please provide more infor of you requiement. I can open a external file following the steps in comments#8. Please notify the IDE plugin and RCP plugin can not work together. "Please notify the IDE plugin and RCP plugin can not work together." That is most likely the problem. So our application will be running as part of the eclipse IDE. Our requirement is that we will have reports that live outside the IDE workspace and project structure, and so we need to be able to load, these reports into the report designer. If I understand correctly, in this case, I can't replace the IDE plugin with the RCP plugin because we are in the IDE. Can we get an IDE API that allows the loading of reports from outside the workspace? Any other workarounds you all can suggest? As i tested, the BIRT RCP plugin can work under eclipe ide enviroment. Do you need specail feature of BIRT IDE plug-in. The main different is BIRT RCP editor don't support eclipe navigator ,workspace and project concept. All file are accessed directly from file system. The BIRT IDE editor support eclipe navigator and alos the workspace and project concept. Can you use RCP editor only? The main feature of BIRT are there with BIRT RCP plugin. What you need to do is remove org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide plug-in from plugins directory and install org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp plug-in in plugins directory. Another work around can be write your own editor by extends from ReportEditor. You need write your own implmementation of interface IReportEditorInput to handle the case of opening external files. Please refer to RCP plugin codes. It's quite easy to do that because there're only a few codes in RCP editor and ReportEditoInput classes. Verified in build 20051226. So I have dug into this extensively using the provided suggestion to implement my own classes. So...on this advice I have implemented my own derived class that implements IReportEditorInput, I have also created my own derived class that implments from ReportEditor. But things still aren't working well. What I want to do,is in the Eclipse IDE, open the eclipse Report design perspective and load my report template into this perspective. currently I do: IWorkbench WB = PlatformUI.getWorkbench(); ... WB.showPerspective(ConfigurationStrings.BIRT_REPORT_PERSPECTIVE_ID,window); ... IEditorRegistry editorRegistry= WB.getEditorRegistry(); IEditorDescriptor descriptor= editorRegistry.getDefaultEditor(file.getName()); editorID = descriptor.getId(); ... activePage.openEditor(input, editorId); So.....is there a easy way to say, use the birt report design perspective but use my (specially created) report editor? Thanks Currently, BIRT can't open report design outside of workspace in IDE enviroment, but can in RCP enviroment. So, if you want to open external report design in your, you may reference to what RCP do. Because plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp and plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide can't work togther, so if you use plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide in your application, you must define a new editor to open external report design, just simply copy from report editor in plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp. I have made a crack patch for plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide which add an editor 'org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide.externalReportEditor', you can open a external report design like PlatformUI.getWorkbench( ).getActivePage( ).openEditor(new ExternalReportEditorInput(new File("D:/test.rptdesign")),"org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide.externalReportEditor"); Hope it help. Created attachment 32898 patch for plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide (In reply to comment #21) > Created an attachment (id=32898) [edit] > patch for plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide > Thanks for the help guys, however, I'm not familiar with this .patch file concept, how is this used? check out the project org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide from eclipse cvs, then aplly patch for this project use the .patch file. Is it possible to enhancement plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.rcp co-exist with plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide OR enhance plugin org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide to open a report dsign that is not in the project? This will allow other IDE based app to embed BIRT report designer. change to enhancement and schedule for 2.1 consideration. Yes I agree that these plug-ins need to live in harmony, would be good to get this fixed for 2.1. Also wanted to Thank Birt developers/team for the patch file, I have encorporated this and it allows me to load files outside the workspace using the IDE plug-in for the time being. However, its still our hopes to see an official long term fix in 2.1. Support report files out of workspace now.

Bug.Summery: Min Slice doesn't apply to legend
Bug.WithStack: When setting the min slice on a pie chart, the legend still shows the colors of the hidden slices. Created attachment 30089 screenshot This requires major changes in the engine, we need to enhance it to filter the data ahead of its processing by the series renderer. That also means we need to enhance the dataset to indicate the "other" value, for non-text data. The legend is being layed out independently of the series renderer, so we can't customize it from there. As it is a minor issue, we can defer it. Increasing severity to P2 as it makes the min slice feature almost useless. The problem also happens for the "other" slice label, not showing the "other" label, but the first hidden category label. Added checking for invalid pie size(e.g. zero, negative). When pie label positions outside, the label size will also affect the usable area for pie slice. So if the text is too long, the pie size will reduce accordingly. wrong comment. fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack: When setting the min slice on a pie chart, the legend still shows the colors of the hidden slices. Created attachment 30089 screenshot This requires major changes in the engine, we need to enhance it to filter the data ahead of its processing by the series renderer. That also means we need to enhance the dataset to indicate the "other" value, for non-text data. The legend is being layed out independently of the series renderer, so we can't customize it from there. As it is a minor issue, we can defer it. Increasing severity to P2 as it makes the min slice feature almost useless. The problem also happens for the "other" slice label, not showing the "other" label, but the first hidden category label. Added checking for invalid pie size(e.g. zero, negative). When pie label positions outside, the label size will also affect the usable area for pie slice. So if the text is too long, the pie size will reduce accordingly. wrong comment. fixed.

Bug.Summery: Auto-wrapping/size of legend

Lines.Line: - Create additional rows or columns for the legend when all the items do not
fit in one column or one row
Just a reminder there was also a problem with displaying the bars or chart info when data sets got larger.

Bug.WithStack:
I'd like to see charts auto size and wrapping of legends so that large data sets are handeled. It looks like over 11 or so sets of data start to have problems displaying in legends as well as in bar charts and some others. +1 for this feature The solution is to - Create additional rows or columns for the legend when all the items do not fit in one column or one row - Wrap the legend strings Just a reminder there was also a problem with displaying the bars or chart info when data sets got larger.
Some type of sizing is most likely needed in the actual chart as well. Maybe something similar to what JFreecharts does with datasets.
Kyle Can you post a screenshot of this other problem? What does JFreechart does? Added engine support, transfer to add UI support. UI support (a text field "Wrapping size") is added. Verified

On the Service Deployment Configuration page, the service project type is shown as "template.jst.web".
If I use the drop-down to pick "Dynamic Web project", the wizard completes successfully. Kathy, it sounds as though the wizard either prevents you from proceeding or fails in some other way unless you explicitly choose "Dynamic Web project". Is that the case? Tentatively setting severity to major. The skeleton scenario actually works all the way even with project type set to template.jst.web. So other than a visual distraction, "template.jst.web" has the same behaviour as setting to "dynamic Web project". Bug.Summery: UnsupportedClassVersionError when using Tomcat 5.5 with default JRE set to 1.4.2
Bug.WithStack:
Driver: I20051116_1051
If your default JRE is set to 1.4.2 and you have a Web project targetting Tomcat 5.5 (dynamic Web module version 2.4 and Java 5.0), when you tried to run a main program, you'll get the error:
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: echo/EchoMain (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:539) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass (SecureClassLoader.java:123) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:251) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:55) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:194) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:289) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:274) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302) Exception in thread "main"
If you switch the default JRE to 1.5, then the problem goes away.
This did not used to cause problem with the 1110_0034 I-build.
Please reassign if appropriate. Not sure why exactly the UnsupportedClassVersionError comes up, but there is definitely a disconnect between the vm version that the server is actually using and what's specified in the server runtime definition. Ideally, the runtime definition should sniff what vm tomcat is using and always use that. The user should not be able to select it. *** Bug 117073 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Raising the severity and requesting for for M9.
If the user launch Eclipse with JDK 1.4.2, even if in the workbench they switch the default JRE to 1.5, they would not be able to run a Web service bottom-up scenario in a Web project targetting Tomcat 5.5. This used to work fine with builds a few days earlier. Fix dropped to HEAD. Opened defect 117372 (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=117372) for the problem with Web services tool described in comment 3. Released for M9. Verified on 1122_2206 S-build.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Driver: I20051116_1051
If your default JRE is set to 1.4.2 and you have a Web project targetting Tomcat 5.5 (dynamic Web module version 2.4 and Java 5.0), when you tried to run a main program, you'll get the error:
Exception in thread "main"
If you switch the default JRE to 1.5, then the problem goes away.
This did not used to cause problem with the 1110_0034 I-build.
Please reassign if appropriate. Not sure why exactly the UnsupportedClassVersionError comes up, but there is definitely a disconnect between the vm version that the server is actually using and what's specified in the server runtime definition. Ideally, the runtime definition should sniff what vm tomcat is using and always use that. The user should not be able to select it. *** Bug 117073 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Raising the severity and requesting for for M9.
If the user launch Eclipse with JDK 1.4.2, even if in the workbench they switch the default JRE to 1.5, they would not be able to run a Web service bottom-up scenario in a Web project targetting Tomcat 5.5. This used to work fine with builds a few days earlier. Fix dropped to HEAD. Opened defect 117372 (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=117372) for the problem with Web services tool described in comment 3. Released for M9. Verified on 1122_2206 S-build.

Bug.Summery: [Reliability] Cannot run a recorded URL test
Bug.WithStack:
I am not user if this is a regression from 4.1 ( or even a valid problem ). We are trying to drop TPTP 4.2 to IES by the end of this week so if this is a valid defects and feel that is critical enough to be fixed by then please let me know. I am currently smoke testing the TPTP 4.2 driver
Scenario: driver http://download.torolab.ibm.com/cgi-bin/TPTP/4.2.0/generate-downloads.sh I had to workaround the config.xml file to update emf and eclipse plugin versions.
After this :
Create a URL recording from Fiel > New > Test > Recording When the browser opens navigate to some random sites Stop the recording
Generate the testsuite in a java project Try to run the testsuite; I get an execution history but with 'failed to run error', reason is that no test was found under the generated test java file
I can try the appropriate TPTP 4.2 build tonight and try to figure out what the problem is (and reproduce). It is definitely a regression if you cannot run a recorded URL test. Please use TPTP-4.2.0-200511161545, there was a RAC runtime problem fixed in the build ( emf and eclipse plugins versions have been changed )
I used: TPTP-4.2.0-200511161545 (workbench side, with all new downloaded dependencies and agent controller side).
I was able to successfully record, generate test code and then execute test fine with this build.
Just to verify, you did a right-click on the test suite in the test navigator and picked "Generate..." to generate the Java code for that URL test? I used 200511161545 build for workbench and RAC and was able to successfully record, generate and execute a simple URL Test. Yes, I did generate the test before running it. I will send you my workspace by mail ( is too big for an attachement ) for you to look at the execution history content. If this looks like a valid result of the run I will close the defect Created attachment 30113 workspace
Okay, this is a common issue that I believe we should have readme or in the documentation already.
You cannot create a test named "Test" because when the code gets generated there are classpaths ambiguities on other classes named "Test" already. Please do not use "Test" as the test name (you can either edit the generate Java test code if you know what you are doing or just create a new test with a different name).
This should be fixed in the future by using fully-qualified class names in the generated code when required (as a usability issue). Notice there are compile errors in the generated code and that is why the test cannot find the class at run-time (since it did not compile). ACTION: Please verify/close this defect. Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.
Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.

I am not user if this is a regression from 4.1 ( or even a valid problem ). We are trying to drop TPTP 4.2 to IES by the end of this week so if this is a valid defects and feel that is critical enough to be fixed by then please let me know. I am currently smoke testing the TPTP 4.2 driver

Just to verify, you did a right-click on the test suite in the test navigator and picked "Generate..." to generate the Java code for that URL test? Bug.Summery: Undo is not available in library editor
Bug.WithStack:
Add an item to the library outline. Choose the edit menu. Actual: Undo is not available. Ctrl-Z does not undo the action.
Make a change to the item you just added. Choose the edit menu. Actual: Undo is not available. Ctrl-Z does not undo the action.
Expected, in both cases: Undo is available. Ctrl-Z undoes the action. it's working. Please confirm if your selection focus on any view of birt perspective. The undo stack gets reset when you add a report item that brings up a dialog box as part of the creation process. For example, add a Data, Text, or Dynamic Text item to the libary. Undo is not available. Control-Z does not work, and Undo is disabled in the Edit menu.
Now, make any change that is NOT adding a report item that brings up a dialog box as part of the creation process. For example, add a label, or change a property such as text or background color. The full undo stack is now available from control-Z or the Edit menu. Note that editing a report design does not show this behavior. Undo is available as expected after adding a report item that brings up a dialog box as part of the creation process. I think the issue is the palette view get focus in your case. We can't let action on main menu and short cut key working for it's a limitation of eclipse. (In reply to comment #4) > I think the issue is the palette view get focus in your case. We can't let > action on main menu and short cut key working for it's a limitation of eclipse. >
OK. I've tested this with a number of different items and I understand now how this works.

Make a change to the item you just added. Choose the edit menu. Actual: Undo is not available. Ctrl-Z does not undo the action.
Expected, in both cases: Undo is available. Ctrl-Z undoes the action. it's working. Please confirm if your selection focus on any view of birt perspective. The undo stack gets reset when you add a report item that brings up a dialog box as part of the creation process. For example, add a Data, Text, or Dynamic Text item to the libary. Undo is not available. Control-Z does not work, and Undo is disabled in the Edit menu.
Now, make any change that is NOT adding a report item that brings up a dialog box as part of the creation process. For example, add a label, or change a property such as text or background color. The full undo stack is now available from control-Z or the Edit menu. Note that editing a report design does not show this behavior. Undo is available as expected after adding a report item that brings up a dialog box as part of the creation process. I think the issue is the palette view get focus in your case. Bug.Summery: NLS missing messages in .log file
Bug.WithStack:
After running through some Ant scenarios I went looking at the .log file and noticed a few NLS missing message entries that need cleaning up. It appears that the IDs exist in the EnvironmentMessages class but the corresponding properties are missing from Environment.properties.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2 1 2005-11-16 13:14:08.400 !MESSAGE NLS missing message: TITLE_WARNING in: org.eclipse.wst.command.internal .env.Environment

Bug.Summery: change classpath in gla scripts because EMF jar filenames have changed
Bug.WithStack:
TPTP 4.2 depends on EMF 2.2. The version of EMF is part of the jar filename. Need to filenames whereever it is referneced in the GLA scripts. org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter/scripts/gla.bat and gla.sh were changed to replace the EMF jar names in the classpath from $GLA_HOME/lib/emf.ecore_2.1.0.jar:$GLA_HOME/lib/emf.common_2.1.0.jar to $GLA_HOME/lib/emf.ecore_2.2.0.jar:$GLA_HOME/lib/emf.common_2.2.0.jar
Changes committed to TPTP HEAD CVS. close bug This was fixed before the official start of 4.2 development but setting the target to 4.2 iteration 1 so it is counted in an iteration.

Bug.Summery: need public APIs to persist remote log adapter trace information
Bug.WithStack:
Tracing / Debugging remote log adapter is very difficult at this moment. In TPTP3.3, GLA can only log messages to the client via the error and status logging agents. However if there is problem for agent communication between client and host ( where the adapter is running ), these log messages are never available to end user.
I was told that TPTP4.1 added some debugging support so that the log produced by TPTP internally can be persisted to a file. However, the third party's log adapter can not write trace to this file. The third party has to find other way ( most likely to create some APIs to write its own trace to other files ). This makes the debugging of third party adapter tidious.
TPTP should provide public trace APIs so that when third party adapter invokes it, the adapter's trace msgs will write to the trace file. It will be extreamly helpful for debugging remote log adapter. This is an enhancement request for 4.2 if I read it correctly Yes, this is really an ehancement request. Setting target to future so it doesn't show up in 4.2 feature query. Due to lack of resources this enhancement request is resolved as WONTFIX. Please feel free to reopen if you consider it's a required enhancement. Closing. As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As such, TPTP is not delivering enhancements. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement is resolved as WONTFIX. For this enhancement to be considered, please re-open with an attached patch including the Description Document (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/development/description_documents.html), code (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/resources/TPTPDevGuide.htm), and test cases (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/TPTP_Testing_Strategy.html).

Bug.Summery: SWT JARs shipped with Eclipse v3.2 (M3) contain '.v3212' suffix.
Bug.WithStack:
SWT JARs shipped with Eclipse v3.2 (M3) contain '.v3212' suffix.
Since applications build on Eclipse may reference JARs directly (see TPTP's Integrated Agent Controller), forward compatibility is broken when migrating to Eclipse v3.2 (M3) since the following SWT JARs files have change names:
org.eclipse.swt_3.1.0.jar --> org.eclipse.swt_3.1.0.v3212c.jar
org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.jar --> org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.v3212.jar
Was this an intentional change? If so, do you intend on renaming this JAR files again when Eclipse v3.2 GAs? We were asked by PDE to support a qualifier in the version. All teams will be doing this for 3.2. You will see in the latest integration build that many teams now have a qualifier on their jar.
I did not realize the qualifier would be the tag from our map file - I thought it would be the tag used by releng to tag the map files themselves.
As far as when Eclipse v3.2 GAs, we do not intend on changing our map file tag. It is up to PDE to decide if it uses the map file tag in the final shipped product. Adding Pascal.
As explained in http://eclipse.org/equinox/documents/plugin-versioning.html, deriving the last segment of the version from the map file is important for build stability (building twice the same input must produce the same output). Therefore the file name will change everytime the SWT team will put something new into the build (note that during the RCs this should not evolve much).
SWT is doing what is expected. Closing.
Bug.WithOutStack:
SWT JARs shipped with Eclipse v3.2 (M3) contain '.v3212' suffix.
Since applications build on Eclipse may reference JARs directly (see TPTP's Integrated Agent Controller), forward compatibility is broken when migrating to Eclipse v3.2 (M3) since the following SWT JARs files have change names:
org.eclipse.swt_3.1.0.jar --> org.eclipse.swt_3.1.0.v3212c.jar
org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.jar --> org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.0.v3212.jar
Was this an intentional change? If so, do you intend on renaming this JAR files again when Eclipse v3.2 GAs? We were asked by PDE to support a qualifier in the version. All teams will be doing this for 3.2. You will see in the latest integration build that many teams now have a qualifier on their jar.
I did not realize the qualifier would be the tag from our map file - I thought it would be the tag used by releng to tag the map files themselves.
As far as when Eclipse v3.2 GAs, we do not intend on changing our map file tag. It is up to PDE to decide if it uses the map file tag in the final shipped product. Adding Pascal.
As explained in http://eclipse.org/equinox/documents/plugin-versioning.html, deriving the last segment of the version from the map file is important for build stability (building twice the same input must produce the same output). Therefore the file name will change everytime the SWT team will put something new into the build (note that during the RCs this should not evolve much).
SWT is doing what is expected. Closing.

Bug.Summery: GLCanvas doesn't set hint for merging mouse motion events
Bug.WithStack:
At least on GTK, the GLCanvas doesn't merge multiple mouse motion events that might happen to be in the event queue. Instead, it floods the listener with lists of old events. Other widgets like Canvas do not show this behaviour.
Test case exhibiting this bug is appended. It uses a waiting event handler to facilitate queuing of mouse motion events. You can see in the program output that the output keeps coming long after the mouse is resting again. Created attachment 30095 Test case source code Fixed > 20051117
Thanks a lot for catching this!
Bug.WithOutStack:
At least on GTK, the GLCanvas doesn't merge multiple mouse motion events that might happen to be in the event queue. Instead, it floods the listener with lists of old events. Other widgets like Canvas do not show this behaviour.
Test case exhibiting this bug is appended. It uses a waiting event handler to facilitate queuing of mouse motion events. You can see in the program output that the output keeps coming long after the mouse is resting again. Created attachment 30095 Test case source code Fixed > 20051117
Thanks a lot for catching this!

Bug.Summery: Class.getInterfaces() reports incorrect result
[PropertiesView] [CellEditors] (regression) Property editor dismissed on mouse up

Lines.Line: 3) fire up a debug session, create a project and add a 'foo.usr' file
4) Open the property view and select a name (i.e. Tiger) in the -Outline- view
5) click on either a text field (name...) or combo value to see the defect

Bug.WithStack:
build I20051108 + latest UI from head
When trying to edit a text field in the Properties view, mouse down activates the cell editor but then mouse up deactivates it. Double-click works though, as does Enter.
I can demo this to you if needed.
See also bug 117357...it -may- be related...
There is a WM_KILLFOCUS event being sent during the activation. So far I've determined that it was working as of I20051116-1332.
Time to do some CVS archeology methinks...
We think that this might be an SWT issue could someone try it out?
To repro:
1) new workspace 2) check out org.eclipse.examples.propertysheet 3) fire up a debug session, create a project and add a 'foo.usr' file 4) Open the property view and select a name (i.e. Tiger) in the -Outline- view 5) click on either a text field (name...) or combo value to see the defect
BTW, this also happens on the Mac...
I've done some investigation into this on Mac. The table notifies listeners of mouseDown, and this activates the CellEditor which sets the focus to be the cell editor's control. Then the table asks Display for the focus control, recieves the cell editor's control, and sends the focusLost event to that control instead of sending it to the control that had focus when the event was triggered.
I was able to fix this by doing the display.getFocusControl() call before notifying any of the listeners of the mouseDown.
SWT broke this after M3 by sending mouse events rather than posting them. We have fixed this (as of yesterday) - try SWT rom HEAD or last nights nightly build.
This was broken on all platforms but should now be fixed. *** Bug 120029 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
build I20051108 + latest UI from head
When trying to edit a text field in the Properties view, mouse down activates the cell editor but then mouse up deactivates it. Double-click works though, as does Enter.
I can demo this to you if needed.
See also bug 117357...it -may- be related...
There is a WM_KILLFOCUS event being sent during the activation. So far I've determined that it was working as of I20051116-1332.
Time to do some CVS archeology methinks...
We think that this might be an SWT issue could someone try it out?
To repro:
1) new workspace 2) check out org.eclipse.examples.propertysheet 3) fire up a debug session, create a project and add a 'foo.usr' file 4) Open the property view and select a name (i.e. Tiger) in the -Outline- view 5) click on either a text field (name...) or combo value to see the defect
BTW, this also happens on the Mac...
I've done some investigation into this on Mac. The table notifies listeners of mouseDown, and this activates the CellEditor which sets the focus to be the cell editor's control. Then the table asks Display for the focus control, recieves the cell editor's control, and sends the focusLost event to that control instead of sending it to the control that had focus when the event was triggered.
I was able to fix this by doing the display.getFocusControl() call before notifying any of the listeners of the mouseDown.
SWT broke this after M3 by sending mouse events rather than posting them. We have fixed this (as of yesterday) - try SWT rom HEAD or last nights nightly build.
This was broken on all platforms but should now be fixed. *** Bug 120029 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug.Summery: JSP editor is leaking memory
Bug.WithStack:
I have one testcase that opens/closes the JSP editor 10 times, one that opens/closes the editor 25 times and one that opens/closes the editor 100 times. Results below:
10 times:
Used Java Heap: 29.87M Working Set: 43.69M Committed: 54.24M Working Set Peak: 43.7M Elapsed Process: 29.98 s Kernel time: 2.97 s Page Faults: 13.28K CPU Time: 28.66 s GDI Objects: 13
25 times:
Used Java Heap: 74.3M Working Set: 88.51M Committed: 84.5M Working Set Peak: 88.52M Elapsed Process: 1.11 m Kernel time: 7.21 s Page Faults: 25.6K CPU Time: 1.08 m GDI Objects: 13
100 times:
Used Java Heap: 276.34M Working Set: 291.51M Committed: 359.42M Working Set Peak: 291.53M Elapsed Process: 4.5 m Kernel time: 27.98 s Page Faults: 82.99K CPU Time: 4.06 m GDI Objects: 13
Notice that the heap size grows as the number of open/close increases. I'll submit a testcase. Created attachment 30096 Testcase
Look for the following JUnit testcases:
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.tests.performance.scalability.RepeatOpenEditorx10TestCase
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.tests.performance.scalability.RepeatOpenEditorx25TestCase
org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.tests.performance.scalability.RepeatOpenEditorx100TestCase Testcase check into HEAD After profiling with YourKit, I'm not seeing anywhere near the magnitude of the leak detailed here. It seems that the test results may be somewhat misleading.
We suspect more needs to be done to manage Display thread events, as the base does with their open editor tests. Is "joinBackgroundJobs()" accomplishing the same thing as "EditorTestHelper#runEvenQueue()"? Maybe we should model our tests after "org.eclipse.jdt.text.tests.performance.OpenEditorTest"
I did find a couple other leaks (content assist processors,and java text tools) but they're small (looks like < 1K for those per open/close), and I've opened bugzillas for them.
I'm marking as invalid unless we have a concrete example of where the editor is leaking badly as indicated. Events such as the draw workbench events are not being run, which led to the OOM exception. Testcase fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I have one testcase that opens/closes the JSP editor 10 times, one that opens/closes the editor 25 times and one that opens/closes the editor 100 times. Results below:
10 times:
Used Java Heap: 29.87M Working Set: 43.69M Committed: 54.24M Working Set Peak: 43.7M Elapsed Process: 29.98 s Kernel time: 2.97 s Page Faults: 13.28K CPU Time: 28.66 s GDI Objects: 13
25 times:

100 times:
Used Java Heap: 276.34M Working Set: 291.51M Committed: 359.42M Working Set Peak: 291.53M Elapsed Process: 4.5 m Kernel time: 27.98 s Page Faults: 82.99K CPU Time: 4.06 m GDI Objects: 13

org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.tests.performance.scalability.RepeatOpenEditorx25TestCase

Bug.Summery: NPE when selecting runtime facet on the Add and remote facet wizard
Bug.WithStack:
When I select a runtime facet on the Add and remote facet wizard, I got a NPE and the bind and filter buttons are disabled. I can see the same problem when using a tomcat server.
The problem is with the current RuntimesPanel class in the plugin org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.ui, in both the handleBindUnbindRuntime() method (line 273) and updateButtons() method (line 310), the line:
if( this.boundRuntime.equals( runtime ) )
should be changed to:
if( this.boundRuntime != null && this.boundRuntime.equals( runtime ) )
This will handle the case where there is originally no bounded runtime on the project. This has already been fixed. This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
Fix has been verified.

should be changed to:

This will handle the case where there is originally no bounded runtime on the project. This has already been fixed. This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
Fix has been verified.

Bug.Summery: [IAC] Cannot execute a Test using Sun JDK 1.5.0 on certain Linux
Bug.WithStack:
Note that when running with Sun JDK 1.5 on some favour of Linux (like SLES9) I need to start the shell like this:
bash --noprofile --norc
For some unknown reasons the existance of certain environment variables will prevent the RemoteSession agent to correctly query the system envivonment variables. This will cause the Executor agent fail to come up. Starting the shell with "--noprofile" and "--norc" will make sure those unfriendly environment variables from adding to the system environment.
A doc entry is required for 4.1. Doc bug 116726 opened for 4.1.
I would recommend deferring this to 4.2 since this is caused by the Linux shell environment. please ensur a proper readme entry is provided, and move this defect to 4.2 for final resolution. Move to 4.2 since a readme is already added. Transfer all normal severity bugs to 4.3 Not containable in 4.3 and retarget to 4.4. Please let me know if you have any concern.
Retarget to future due to resource limitation. This will be reimplemented by Navid. Updated target to match the iteration when this defect has been processed As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this originator of this enhancement/defect has an inactive Bugzilla account and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: [Webdoc] (README) IAC on Linux may not run Test with Sun JDK 1.5.0
Bug.WithStack:
From bug 116725.
When using the IAC on some Linux favour, it may not be able to execute a test properly using Sun JRE 1.5. The reason maye be caused by the existance of certain "non-standard" environment variables. To workaround this problem, start the shell using the following command:
bash --noprofile --norc
and then start Eclipse from the same shell.
For some unknown reasons the existance of certain environment variables will prevent the RemoteSession agent to correctly query the system envivonment variables. This will cause the Executor agent fail to come up. Starting the shell with "--noprofile" and "--norc" will make sure those unfriendly environment variables from adding to the system environment. Samson, let me know if I've misunderstood and this wasn't supposed to be a README entry.
Abdullah, we're supposed to have all web doc changes for the driver in by EOD today. - Samson added the following in an email. "The status bar will stop shortly above 60% and then a dialog saying "IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems: org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException" will pop up."
- Sending this readme item to Ruth Lee for review and check-in. This is item 1.7.9 in the 41 release notes - http://eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/releasenotes/releasenotes4_1_0.html.
Reviewed and checked in. Closing.

bash --noprofile --norc
and then start Eclipse from the same shell.
For some unknown reasons the existance of certain environment variables will prevent the RemoteSession agent to correctly query the system envivonment variables. This will cause the Executor agent fail to come up. Starting the shell with "--noprofile" and "--norc" will make sure those unfriendly environment variables from adding to the system environment. Samson, let me know if I've misunderstood and this wasn't supposed to be a README entry.

Bug.Summery: Provide Logging Agent sample.
Bug.WithStack:
Provide Logging Agent sample.
Often TPTP users want to load Common Base Event log data in the TPTP Log View or extend existing proprietary loggers for live monitoring (similar to TPTP's Logging Agent support for various logging facilities, such as Java Logging). As such, provide a sample similar to the http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/ >> Documentation >> EclipseWorld 2005 >> Using and Extending the Test and Performance Tools Platform >> source >> Demo_Agents >> eclipseworld.tutorial.demo.agents.DemoLoggingAgent (and DemoStatisticalAgent) to instruct user on how to instrument Java code using the Logging Agent using the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core.LoggingAgent class in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core plugin. The sample could also point to the TPTP product documentation on deploying plugins to a remote Agent Controller for remote monitoring (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/ >> Documentation >> EclipseWorld 2005 >> Using and Extending the Test and Performance Tools Platform >> source >> Demo_Agents).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 87304 *** Closing.

Bug.Summery: Crashing with FIFO-File in working directory

Lines.Line: does it work if CDT is not installed?

Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse crashed when I creat a fifo file in my working directory. Eclipse stopped to work or will not be ready refreshing working directory and hangs up. My testing systems: (1) Eclipse 3.0, Intel-64-Bit, CDT 2.1, 1.5GB RAM, Debian (2) Eclipse 3.1.1 AMD-XP2100, CDT 3.0.1, 1.5GB RAM, Gentoo (3) Eclipse 3.1.1 Centrino 1.5, CDT 3.0.0, 1GB RAM, Gentoo does it work if CDT is not installed? From: Andreas Bartel [abartel@htwm.de]
Refreshing filelist seems to work without CDT, but crashed when I try to open file, too.
change to platform Sorry, I don't know what a "FIFO-File" or a "filelist" is... can you give steps to reproduce? If there is an error, you can tell us what it says? If it hangs, can you provide a VM stack trace by invoking "kill -3" on the java process? Email from originator:
In Unix you can use a FIFO-PIPE for the IPC (Interprocesscomunication). For creat a fifo (fifo-filetype) you can use the command: "mkfifo test" in working directory, refresh file list in eclispe and it hangs up. Please provide the stack trace file when it is hung. Use ps to find the pid of the Java process, and then use "kill -3 <pid>". This will produce a dump file in the current working directory of the Eclipse process, which should then be attached to this bug report. Please reopen with required information. *** Bug 177527 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** "kill -3 <pid>" don't do anything !

Bug.Summery: no icons show up for geo shapes in outline view (in tree mode)
Bug.WithStack:
Create a logic diagram create oval shape, rectangle and a LED open the outline view switch the outline view to the Tree mode you will notice that the entries for the rectangle and the oval shape had no icons (also the root had no icon) the Led icon shows up Purpose: Bugzilla#116729 no icons show up for geo shapes in outline view (in tree mode) Fixed a number of little issues with the GeoshapeIconProvider and DiagramIconProvider that probably all came up as a result of the various GMF migrations.
Activities: Bugzilla#116729 gmf_head cmahoney 060529 no icons show up for geo shapes in outline view (in tree mode)
Code Reviewed by: Linda
How tested: Verified note, text, and geoshape icons show up in outline tree view and diagram assistants.
JUnit Tests: org.eclipse.gmf.tests.runtime.diagram.ui -- all passed [GMF Restructure] Bug 319140 : product GMF and component Runtime Diagram was the original product and component for this bug
Bug.WithOutStack:
Create a logic diagram create oval shape, rectangle and a LED open the outline view switch the outline view to the Tree mode you will notice that the entries for the rectangle and the oval shape had no icons (also the root had no icon) the Led icon shows up Purpose: Bugzilla#116729 no icons show up for geo shapes in outline view (in tree mode) Fixed a number of little issues with the GeoshapeIconProvider and DiagramIconProvider that probably all came up as a result of the various GMF migrations.
Activities: Bugzilla#116729 gmf_head cmahoney 060529 no icons show up for geo shapes in outline view (in tree mode)
Code Reviewed by: Linda
How tested: Verified note, text, and geoshape icons show up in outline tree view and diagram assistants.
JUnit Tests: org.eclipse.gmf.tests.runtime.diagram.ui -- all passed [GMF Restructure] Bug 319140 : product GMF and component Runtime Diagram was the original product and component for this bug

Bug.Summery: [PPC] gpf on editing or saving

Lines.Line: Adding osgi.locking=none to configuration/config.ini seemed to make it a little more stable, but not much. By the way, I cannot found any reference to that in the documentation.

Bug.WithStack:
Many times when editing a file or saving I get a gpf error and Eclipse closes. I can't reproduce the exact steps, as usually is just a matter to start editing a file or trying to save the work.

find attached a gpf dump sample Happens during an OS call made by SWT What version of GTK+ do you have installed? (In reply to comment #3) > What version of GTK+ do you have installed? In ubuntu, use "dpkg -l | grep libgtk2.0" to see what specific version is in use.
From your log, you are on a Linux/PPC machine and using the IBM Java 5.0 JRE. Bug 111305 is another log of a crash with this VM. Can you try with an IBM 1.4.2 VM for this architecture? You said it also crashed under FC4, was this with the same VM (also Java 5)?
The other interesting thing about your crash is that it occurs in an input method:

Do you have any crash logs from when you were running on FC4?
As for the input method, in any GTK+ text editor or edit box, right click and look under the menu "input methods". If you have chosen an alternate keyboard input layout then it may not be on "default". Depending on what kind of keyboard you have and what you have configured in your preferences, you may be using an alternate input scheme to be able to type accented characters etc. (In reply to comment #7) > Do you have any crash logs from when you were running on FC4? > No sorry!

Now I'm trying to reproduce the bug on JDK 1.4.2 ... -- Toni Please also try with different input methods. > Do you have any crash logs from when you were running on FC4?
I have those, because I'm seeing this same crash, and it's preventing me from using Eclipse, at least with the IBM 1.5.0 beta JDK. Eclipse starts (slowly), then when it comes all the way up, I open a file to edit, then I use the mouse to put the cursor where I want to type some content, and the very first key I press causes the crash.
My machine is a PowerBook G4 running Fedora Core 4 PPC. I have updated my kernel to 2.6.14. I can run any commands you'd like to help diagnose. Just ask.
Shouldn't this bug be a P1? Or, is it lower priority only because this particular JDK is still a beta?
I will attach the javacore log file next. Created attachment 31089 Crash dump on Fedora Core 4 of IBM JDK 1.5.0 beta.
This is a crash of 3.2M3, but the same thing happens with v3.1 (release) or v3.1.1 (release) with IBM JDK 1.5.0 beta on Fedora Core 4. I am also trying IBM JDK 1.4.2 on FC4 PPC. Today, I cannot reproduct this bug. I did try this before, and I'm pretty sure I was able to reproduce it that way, but I can't at the moment.
Also, this bug seems intermittent. Sometimes when I run Eclipse on IBM JDK 1.5.0 beta, I can edit files. Then later, while it is still running, it crashes like this, and when I restart it I can't edit files at all -- the first character I type into the editor crashes it.
About which gtk I have, here is some info that may help:
# rpm -q gtk2 gtk2-2.6.10-2
# ls /usr/lib/libgtk* /usr/lib/libgtk-1.2.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtk-1.2.so.0.9.1 /usr/lib/libgtkhtml-2.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtkhtml-2.so.0.0.0 /usr/lib/libgtkhtml-3.6.so.18 /usr/lib/libgtkhtml-3.6.so.18.0.2 /usr/lib/libgtkmathview_custom_reader.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtkmathview_custom_reader.so.0.7.5 /usr/lib/libgtkmathview_libxml2_reader.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtkmathview_libxml2_reader.so.0.7.5 /usr/lib/libgtkmathview_libxml2.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtkmathview_libxml2.so.0.7.5 /usr/lib/libgtksourceview-1.0.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtksourceview-1.0.so.0.0.0 /usr/lib/libgtkspell.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtkspell.so.0.0.0 /usr/lib/libgtk-x11-2.0.so /usr/lib/libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0 /usr/lib/libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0.600.10
Stephan, have you ever seen this crash before? Created attachment 31093 Crash log
Yes, the crash comes only at editing java code. If I save it then I get the crash like in bug 111305. Just to see what would happen, I built Eclipse 3.2M3 from source on my Fedora Core 4 powerbook (the same one where I saw the crash in the first place). I built it with the IBM 1.5.0 beta JDK -- I had to set AWT_LIB_PATH like this:
# export AWT_LIB_PATH=/opt/IBMJava2-ppc-142/jre/bin
Then I built Eclipse like this (as per the directions):
# ./build -os linux -ws gtk -arch ppc -compilelibs
After tinkering with a build problem with the launchertmp/library/gtk path, I was able to get it to build successfully, and then I unpacked and ran it and tested this bug again. Same thing. It crashes in the editor, with the same stack trace.
I played with it some more and found that if I typed very slowly (wait for all IDE activity to stop by watching a CPU load monitor, then typing at most one character per second or two), I could type somewhere around 8 characters or so into the editor before it crashes. Typing any faster makes it crash earlier, or not waiting until all CPU activity stops before typing also makes it crash right away. This is how it behaves in both the pre-compiled binary I downloaded from eclipse.org, and also the one I built from source.
Update:
This week sometime IBM has released their JDK 1.5.0 GA. I just downloaded it and tried Eclipse again. It crashes in exactly the same way it did when I ran it on the IBM 1.5.0 beta. Also, I see that the file contents of these two different versions of the IBM 1.5.0 are different, so there were changes, but apparently nothing that fixes this bug. I have not tried to recompile Eclipse from source with the GA release, however (I'm not sure that would matter).
Since this bug prevents anyone from using Eclipse on 32-bit PPC Linux with the only implementation (IBM) of Java 1.5 for the platform, can we change the priority of this bug at least to P2?
The problem doesn't occur for me any longer with the 1.5 GA version. Seems to be fixed in this version and I think the bug can closed from my POV. I just tried it again with IBM JDK 1.5.0 GA running Eclipse 3.2M4, and it crashes exactly the same way.
Jason, your crash is also in the input method handler. Which input method are you using?
I tried to reproduce this crash on our Linux-PPC machine using the 5.0 GA VM and so far have not been able to. Earlier, when I was trying 3.2M3 I tried at least a few different input methods, including "Default", and they all acted the same. I just checked which input method I had selected for 3.2M4, and it's "Default". I also tried the "X Input Method" and that doesn't work either.
I agree with Jason. I have the same effect on 3.2 and it doesn't matter the input type or the virtual machine. I have this issue either on IBM JDK 1.4.2 or JDK 1.5 with a Ubuntu Linux. I have also observed another effect: the 3.2 version on PPC get lots of memory compared with the i386 version given the default configuration.
This bug makes Eclipse for PPC unusable for me. :( Created attachment 32388 Configuration details
I added my configuration details as a file. Maybe you can compare it with your configurations to see if there is a difference that can explain why it works for me and not for you. And please ensure you use the same "java.fullversion". And as a side note, I use an up-to-date version of Ubuntu Dapper. Your configuration info got me farther. I noticed that in your configuration, you disregarded the configuration instructions given on the download page that say that you should set "-vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none". You don't have that set. I always had it set (I do try to follow directions :). Once I removed that, my startup command looks like this:
$ /home/jbrittain/eclipse-3.2M4/eclipse -clean -vm /opt/ibm/java2-ppc-50/bin/java
When I run it like that, I no longer get the crash that I reported earlier. I can type into the editor, and the characters now show up, and after a few seconds the CPU goes idle again and I can continue to type. So, I can now edit Java code. I also checked that my config's "java.fullversion" is exactly the same as yours. Few other things look different when I diff the config sets.
BUT: Now I get a different crash..
When I edit for a bit, then switch desktop pages to where my Mozilla is, use the web a little, then switch back to the desktop page where Eclipse is, Eclipse crashes after several seconds of trying to repaint the window. It appears I can reproduce this bug frequently, but not quite every time.
Shall I file this as a separate bug? It's a different stack trace -- yet another SWT native code crash. (Wasn't this one of the problems Java existed to prevent in the first place?)
I will attach the javacore text file..
Created attachment 32394 SWT crash on linux ppc when switching desktop pages. Created attachment 37115 crash as soon as character is typed in C/C++ editor
I get the same error as soon as I type a character in the C/C++ editor. It appears to be completely reproducable. I see the error with or without the -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none options.
I'm using IBM JRE 5.0 on a Yellow Dog 4.1 system (a ppc machine.) Maybe copying/pasting or backspacing makes it happen quicker. I'm using the default input method and I've tried more than one theme, nothing helps ...
This renders the program almost unusable under ppc.
I've tried with IBM JVM 1.4.2, same result. I upgraded gtk+ (now at 2.8.18 from 2.6.4) and glib2.0 (now at 2.10.2 from 2.6.4) but still I get the same error.
I using Debian stable/testing.

In the hope that it will help find the bug let me tell you that once I get the gpf I have only two ways to be able to start working again:
a) kill the X server (it's a bit of an overkill but sometimes it works)
b) completely erase (rm -rf) the directories configuration/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/ configuration/org.eclipse.core.runtime/ They are recreated. That gives me some more time of work until the next gpf. That seems to work everytime.
If I don't take one of those steps I will always get the gpf at the first keypress.
And definitely, copy/pasting (^C/^V) makes the problem worse. But X highlighting and middle-button copying seems to work ok. *** Bug 176942 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I was able to reproduce this bug with the java 5 vm, however since running with the '-Xnojit' vm argument I have not crashed. Has anyone else tried this vm arg? Also note that I've never crashed running the 1.4.2 vm, nor have I crashed using the early access Java 6 vm that is now available.
Since this appears to be a VM bug, I'm marking it as WORKSFORME. Note that a warning about the IBM Java 5 VM has been added to the click through for the Linux-PPC build on the Eclipse download page. I can't find any note of this on the download pages. Plus, the Eclipse Reference Platforms on this page:
http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/eclipse_project_plan_3_2.html#TargetOperatingEnvironments
Shows that the IBM JVM is the only officially suggested JVM for PPC Linux, while showing nothing about this bug. It even lists the exact version of the IBM JVM that this bug is reported against.
I cannot test newer PPC Linux JVMs since I no longer have a PPC machine to try it on (believe me, I'm happier). But, unless you're testing on Fedora, Ubuntu, or Yellow Dog as the bug was reported on, then you can't see if it works or not. Kevin: which distro/version did you test on?
Also, since this bug has had no attention for about a year, it's possible that it's no longer valid for modern versions of these distros. But, at least the docs should say that Eclipse may not run on the versions of the IBM JVM we reported this bug against.
We tested on Yellowdog 4.1 which is the only PPC-linux machine that we have access to.
The following text was added to the "Important Notes" click through page for future builds (starting with I20070511-0010). Every user sees this page before they can download the Linux-PPC build.
When running on the IBM Java 5.0 VM, Eclipse crashes while the user is typing in an editor. If using this VM you must disable the JIT with the -Xnojit vm argument to avoid the crashes (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=116730). The command line for launching Eclipse with this vm should be: "eclipse -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none -Xnojit" I'll also point out that all of the attached crash logs are for the 1.5.0 vm and we have not been able to reproduce the crash on the 1.4.2 vm.
The reference platform for PPC is 1.4.2 (according to the 3.2 final plan linked above, and the 3.3 draft play here http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/eclipse_project_plan_3_3.html#TargetOperatingEnvironments)

I noticed that in your configuration, you disregarded the configuration instructions given on the download page that say that you should set "-vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none". You don't have that set. I always had it set (I do try to follow directions :). Once I removed that, my startup command looks like this:
$ /home/jbrittain/eclipse-3.2M4/eclipse -clean -vm /opt/ibm/java2-ppc-50/bin/java

In the hope that it will help find the bug let me tell you that once I get the gpf I have only two ways to be able to start working again:
a) kill the X server (it's a bit of an overkill but sometimes it works)
b) completely erase (rm -rf) the directories configuration/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/ configuration/org.eclipse.core.runtime/ They are recreated. That gives me some more time of work until the next gpf. That seems to work everytime.
If I don't take one of those steps I will always get the gpf at the first keypress.
And definitely, copy/pasting (^C/^V) makes the problem worse. But X highlighting and middle-button copying seems to work ok. *** Bug 176942 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I was able to reproduce this bug with the java 5 vm, however since running with the '-Xnojit' vm argument I have not crashed. Has anyone else tried this vm arg? Also note that I've never crashed running the 1.4.2 vm, nor have I crashed using the early access Java 6 vm that is now available.
Since this appears to be a VM bug, I'm marking it as WORKSFORME. Note that a warning about the IBM Java 5 VM has been added to the click through for the Linux-PPC build on the Eclipse download page. I can't find any note of this on the download pages. Plus, the Eclipse Reference Platforms on this page:
http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/eclipse_project_plan_3_2.html#TargetOperatingEnvironments
Shows that the IBM JVM is the only officially suggested JVM for PPC Linux, while showing nothing about this bug. It even lists the exact version of the IBM JVM that this bug is reported against.
I cannot test newer PPC Linux JVMs since I no longer have a PPC machine to try it on (believe me, I'm happier). But, unless you're testing on Fedora, Ubuntu, or Yellow Dog as the bug was reported on, then you can't see if it works or not. Kevin: which distro/version did you test on?
Also, since this bug has had no attention for about a year, it's possible that it's no longer valid for modern versions of these distros. But, at least the docs should say that Eclipse may not run on the versions of the IBM JVM we reported this bug against.
We tested on Yellowdog 4.1 which is the only PPC-linux machine that we have access to.
The following text was added to the "Important Notes" click through page for future builds (starting with I20070511-0010). Every user sees this page before they can download the Linux-PPC build.
When running on the IBM Java 5.0 VM, Eclipse crashes while the user is typing in an editor. If using this VM you must disable the JIT with the -Xnojit vm argument to avoid the crashes (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=116730). The command line for launching Eclipse with this vm should be: "eclipse -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none -Xnojit" I'll also point out that all of the attached crash logs are for the 1.5.0 vm and we have not been able to reproduce the crash on the 1.4.2 vm.
The reference platform for PPC is 1.4.2 (according to the 3.2 final plan linked above, and the 3.3 draft play here http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/development/eclipse_project_plan_3_3.html#TargetOperatingEnvironments)

Bug.Summery: [DataBinding] BindingException should be an unchecked exception

source_code.code: BindingException changed to subclass RuntimeException and all of the now unnecessary throws and try{}

Bug.WithStack:
Since the reasons for throwing of BindingExceptions are programming errors, not external problems (like IOException), it should be an unchecked exception, i.e. it should be a subclass of RuntimeException, not be declared on methods, and not required to catch. Thanks to Nick for pointing this out. BindingException changed to subclass RuntimeException and all of the now unnecessary throws and try{}catch{} blocks now removed Okay; I don't see either Boris or Joe online, so I'm going to assume that the coast is clear for making the Big Refactoring and do that now.
Please IM me ASAP if that is not true. Reopening - the Javadoc needs to be changed to say that this is an unchecked exception. Fixed/committed; 20060118. eclipse-platform-I20060215-1600-linux-gtk.tar.gz >> Verified by importing source and examining BindingException.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Since the reasons for throwing of BindingExceptions are programming errors, not external problems (like IOException), it should be an unchecked exception, i.e. it should be a subclass of RuntimeException, not be declared on methods, and not required to catch. Thanks to Nick for pointing this out. Bug.Summery: The profile item for JUnit plugins is missing tabs
Bug.WithStack:
Build: TPTP-4.2.0-200511161037
Open the profile launch configuration and create a new JUnit plugin item. Notice that the 'Main' tab that used to allow the user to specify the workspace location is now missing. When I attempted to profile a JUnit plugin, the second workbench was not automatically launched, instead I was prompted to enter a path for a workspace.
If you open the run configuration dialog and create a new JUnit plugin item, you'll notice that it displays the 'Main' tab. PluginJUnitMainTab() is missing in the TabGroup 'JRE' tab is also missing in JUnit configuration type. and 'Plugins' tab is missing in JUnit Test Plugin configuration type. Please note JRE should not be in the included as it won't be considered in profile launch. The JRE specified in RAC/IAC is used instead. added missing plugins Mike Hao verified this in TPTP-4.2.0-200511162309

Bug.WithStack:
In the Installing TPTP packages section of the install guide, it says:
"Download the desired TPTP Runtime and SDK (4.0.0 | 4.0.1) packages (Platform, Monitoring Tools, Testing Tools, or All), by clicking a Runtime or SDK link as appropriate. Select an appropriate download site and save the zip file."
1. In TPTP 4.1.0, there is a trace project zip file. Need to add that to the list in the bracket. 2. Monitoring, Trace and Test project zip files require the Platform zip file to run. So we need to include this meaning in the sentense, so that users won't just download the test project zip file and thinks he has everything needed by the test project. This comment applies to version 4.0.0 and 4.0.1 as well. Done. In section "Installing TPTP packages", "Tracing and Profiling Tools" is still missing in the bracket in the first sentence of point #1. I think you can remove the whole bracket. Hubert, I added "Tracing and Profiling Tools" into the bracket only in the v4.1.0 of the guide. I deliberately omitted it in v4.0.0 because trace didn't have a separate download in v4.0.0. I am not planning to remove the bracket at this time. close bug Move TPTP.Web because Test.Web will be removed.

"Download the desired TPTP Runtime and SDK (4.0.0 | 4.0.1) packages (Platform, Monitoring Tools, Testing Tools, or All), by clicking a Runtime or SDK link as appropriate. Select an appropriate download site and save the zip file."
1. In TPTP 4.1.0, there is a trace project zip file. Need to add that to the list in the bracket. 2. Monitoring, Trace and Test project zip files require the Platform zip file to run. So we need to include this meaning in the sentense, so that users won't just download the test project zip file and thinks he has everything needed by the test project. This comment applies to version 4.0.0 and 4.0.1 as well. Done. In section "Installing TPTP packages", "Tracing and Profiling Tools" is still missing in the bracket in the first sentence of point #1. I think you can remove the whole bracket. Hubert, I added "Tracing and Profiling Tools" into the bracket only in the v4.1.0 of the guide. I deliberately omitted it in v4.0.0 because trace didn't have a separate download in v4.0.0. I am not planning to remove the bracket at this time. close bug Move TPTP.Web because Test.Web will be removed.

The return of IEnterpriseApplicaiton.getURI(IModule) is incorrect.
1. The return URI has a forward slash '/' in the begining of the string. 2. When IModule is a IWebModule, it returns /<moduleName>.jar instead of .war extension 3. The URI return is null for the rest of the other modules, i.e. IEJBModule, IConnectorModule, IApplicationClientModule, within the EAR. This is released to head. We should be able to drop for M9 final, prolly the 1122 integration driver. This ia part of a mass update, marking fixed blockers older than 6 months as automatically verified (the logic being it must be fixed or we sure would have heard about it!) Bug.Summery: Indexer loops on openldap
Bug.WithStack: I have Ecliupse cdt 3.0 and 3.0.1. If I create a project that has openldap in it the indexer stalls on "connection.c" when I start eclipse and indexing never finishes.
