Bug.Summery: Dynamic text content type has no effect
Bug.WithStack:
I have a db field with three types of content: 1) HTML text within <html> ...</html> tag. 2) HTML fragments not within <html> tag 3) Text with RTF tags
I use a dynamic text element to display the contents of this field. The report displays the same results whether I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML.
Expected results: For Plain, I expect the literal content (tags and all) to be displayed. For Auto, I expect content 1, 2 and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags. For HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.
See attached report. Created attachment 30100 report design The UI create the contentType as string property while the ROM_Text_SPEC.pdf defines the contentType as expression.
The text "html", "auto" and "plain" are all invalid javascript expressions, so ENGINE use "auto" as it's contentType.
UI should use expression in the contextType.
see: ROM_Text_Spec 3.3 Multi-Line Data Item value An expression that provides the text. contentType An optional expression that defines the type of text.
Change default content type to html. Verified in build 20051125.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I have a db field with three types of content: 1) HTML text within <html> ...</html> tag. 2) HTML fragments not within <html> tag 3) Text with RTF tags
I use a dynamic text element to display the contents of this field. The report displays the same results whether I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML.
Expected results: For Plain, I expect the literal content (tags and all) to be displayed. For Auto, I expect content 1, 2 and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags. For HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.
See attached report. Created attachment 30100 report design The UI create the contentType as string property while the ROM_Text_SPEC.pdf defines the contentType as expression.
The text "html", "auto" and "plain" are all invalid javascript expressions, so ENGINE use "auto" as it's contentType.
UI should use expression in the contextType.
see: ROM_Text_Spec 3.3 Multi-Line Data Item value An expression that provides the text. contentType An optional expression that defines the type of text.
Change default content type to html. Verified in build 20051125.

Bug.Summery: Custom Combo: drop down menu shouldn't show focus ring
Bug.WithStack: The drop down menu of the Custom Combo shouldn't show a focus ring since menus on Mac never show the focus ring. However, the text field of the Custom Combo should show focus but doesn't. Who ever said that a CCombo is a menu? It no longer draws it.

Bug.Summery: Custom Combo: drop down menu is hard to use
Bug.WithStack:
The drop down menu of the Custom Combo uses a List widget which has a selection behavior that is not suitable for menus because you have to hit the text in order to select an item. Clicking in the white space after the text just dismissed the menu but doesn't select the item.
I suggest to use a Table instead of a List widget. We won't change to a table but we might fix list to select the way you want (someday). Fixed > 20080410

Bug.Summery: Use NLS message bundle convention for WebServiceScenario messages
Bug.WithStack:
There were a few places which I didn't feel confident making the conversion to NLS message bundles. They were in WebServiceScenario.java, WebServiceRuntimeExtensionUtil.java, and WebServiceRuntimeExtensionUtil2.java.
They use a field the from a class to get the key, and uses the value to set the label. Instead, we want to get the value by referencing the field from the Message class directly. We need to eliminate the use of MessageUtils here too. Created attachment 36920 apply to org.eclipse.wst.ws
patch 1 of 2 Created attachment 36921 apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui
patch 2 of 2 The attached patches are ready to be committed. accepting the bug Patches reviewed, committed and released to WTP 1.5 as v200603291915. Closing

Bug.Summery: Modify the CommandLine Args tag for a Process
[package explorer] show structure of archive content
Bug.WithStack:
When a jar file is on a build path, it displays in the resource tree as a jar, and I can poke around inside it. If not, It shows as an ordinary document and opens as binary glop. It would be helpful to be able to browse an arbitrary jar.
Note, the jar's I'm trying to look at are created by generated PDE build.xml files, which have an odd tendency to create jars with the zip task instead of the jar task. John, you were looking into this: Use EFS to show a JAR as IFile structure. Any results? It can certainly be done, and there is an example plugin that adds simple expand/collapse actions for expanding zip files in the resource tree (org.eclipse.ui.examples.filesystem). There was some concern with adding it directly to the platform because many plugins cannot handle IFiles that are not backed by the local file system. Of course the easiest thing for the end user to do is add the JAR to the build path so all the Java browsing/searching capabilities are available.
You can mark this as a dup of bug 23265.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 23265 ***

John, you were looking into this: Use EFS to show a JAR as IFile structure. Any results? It can certainly be done, and there is an example plugin that adds simple expand/collapse actions for expanding zip files in the resource tree (org.eclipse.ui.examples.filesystem). Bug.Summery: [KeyBindings] "o" stops working
Bug.WithStack:
This is totally strange. I am using N20051115-0010, in a Java editor, trying to type "normal" in a comment. The "n" appeared, but then the "o" and other normal letter keys stop working. Ctrl-O still works.
Switching to another open editor and back does not help, and switching to another application and back does not help either. I had to close the editor and reopen it. Happened again. Interesting observation: pressing "." opens the code completion pop-up. Neither lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, symbols work. Did you spill something on your keyboard? :) And AIOOBEs are appearing in your log, yes? yes. Pick up I20051116-1332 or later....

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run (PlatformActivator.java:226) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run (EclipseStarter.java:376) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run (EclipseStarter.java:163) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948) Caused by: java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.sampledb.ui.i18n.messages, locale en_US at java.util.ResourceBundle.throwMissingResourceException(Unknown Source) at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundleImpl(Unknown Source) at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.sampledb.ui.i18n.Messages.<clinit> (Messages.java:26) ... 38 more The bug is caused by not including the bundle file of i18n.Message.java file during the compilation. So that the produced jar does not has corresponding Message.properties file, which leads to the error.
Fix it in source
Verified in build 20051118.

Bug.Summery: Invalid Menu Extension error in log of RCP application
Bug.WithStack:
>I get this annoying message in the log of my RCP application: >> >> !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-11-14 14:04:42.171 >> !MESSAGE Invalid Menu Extension (Path is invalid): >> org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.gotoLastEditPosition
I'd recommend filing a bug with Platform/Text. They must have some action set that uses a menu it does not explicitly define. I assume you're using an old build. This has been fixed a while ago. If you still see this using R3.1 or newer then please reopen and add more details.
See also: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/bug-incomplete.htm Sorry about forgetting the version. This happens on the 3.1.1 released build.
My RCP app uses IDE classes, so maybe that has something to do with it.
Let me know if you need more information.

Do you customize the the workbench? org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.gotoLastEditPosition is defined in org.eclipse.ui.editors and hence can expect that "org.eclipse.ui.workbench.navigate/history.group" is available.
Also try the following: reset the perspective (Window > Reset Perspective), shutdown and restart.
Note that both ui.ide and ui.editors aren't built to be used in RCP.

Do you customize the the workbench? org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.gotoLastEditPosition is defined in org.eclipse.ui.editors and hence can expect that "org.eclipse.ui.workbench.navigate/history.group" is available.
Also try the following: reset the perspective (Window > Reset Perspective), shutdown and restart.
Note that both ui.ide and ui.editors aren't built to be used in RCP.

Bug.Summery: Eclipse UI lockup with dependant External JAR configured, CPU hog type lockup
Bug.WithStack:
wtp-sdk-I200511161432
Have a Dynamic Web Project ready. Have a J2EE Utility JAR (project) ready. Now in the Dynamic Web Project goto Properties -> J2EE Dependancies -> Web Modules In this tab add a tick to the J2EE Utility project. In this same tab click "Add External JARs", pick something and link it in.
Now create a Server Runtime (Tomcat v5.5) Now add this Web Module to runtime, if you look at the drop down in the tree view that exists when selecting the web-module you will see the web-module name is repeated below itself. It looks like its recuring into itself.
Now if you select it to put on right hand site, and/or click finish and maybe go onto publish you should be able to observe the Eclipse lockup.
Not marked major as I don't need use of the functionality at this time, I was testing to see what it actually did for me. But it configured the build path which is not what I had expected from the J2EE Dependancy properties page. The UI issue is a dup of bug 116778 and the functional issues with dependant jars (doesn't publish correctly) are already covered in bug 116783.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 116778 *** This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
Bug.WithOutStack:
wtp-sdk-I200511161432
Have a Dynamic Web Project ready. Have a J2EE Utility JAR (project) ready. Now in the Dynamic Web Project goto Properties -> J2EE Dependancies -> Web Modules In this tab add a tick to the J2EE Utility project. In this same tab click "Add External JARs", pick something and link it in.
Now create a Server Runtime (Tomcat v5.5) Now add this Web Module to runtime, if you look at the drop down in the tree view that exists when selecting the web-module you will see the web-module name is repeated below itself. It looks like its recuring into itself.
Now if you select it to put on right hand site, and/or click finish and maybe go onto publish you should be able to observe the Eclipse lockup.
Not marked major as I don't need use of the functionality at this time, I was testing to see what it actually did for me. But it configured the build path which is not what I had expected from the J2EE Dependancy properties page. The UI issue is a dup of bug 116778 and the functional issues with dependant jars (doesn't publish correctly) are already covered in bug 116783.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 116778 *** This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.

Bug.Summery: [Viewers] Memory leak in TreeViewerTest, or TreeViewer, or Tree
"Top n", "Bottom n", "Top percent" and "Bottom percent" are supported by DTE now.
Bug.WithStack: Description: "Top n", "Bottom n", "Top percent" and "Bottom percent" are supported by DTE now. They should be added into "Operators" list. Model team should add these operators It's transparent to GUI code. Enable that in ROM. Verified in build 20051118.
Bug.WithOutStack: Description: "Top n", "Bottom n", "Top percent" and "Bottom percent" are supported by DTE now. They should be added into "Operators" list. Model team should add these operators It's transparent to GUI code. Enable that in ROM. Verified in build 20051118.

Bug.Summery: In group builder, data set columns are not listed in "sorting" and "filters" expression drop down list.

Lines.Line: 1. Add a table and bind it to a data set, edit it.
2. Add a group, group builder pops up.
3. In "sorting" tab, pull down expression list.
4. Data set columns are not listed.
The coulumn list now appears correctly.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: In group builder, data set columns are not listed in "sorting" and "filters" expression drop down list.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a table and bind it to a data set, edit it. 2. Add a group, group builder pops up. 3. In "sorting" tab, pull down expression list. 4. Data set columns are not listed. 5. The same problem occurs in "filters". The coulumn list now appears correctly. Verified in build 20051125.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: In group builder, data set columns are not listed in "sorting" and "filters" expression drop down list.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a table and bind it to a data set, edit it. 2. Add a group, group builder pops up. 3. In "sorting" tab, pull down expression list. 4. Data set columns are not listed. 5. The same problem occurs in "filters". The coulumn list now appears correctly. Verified in build 20051125.

Bug.Summery: Support for Lenses
Bug.WithStack: I would like support for fisheye and bifocal lenses like prefuse provides. Is this slated as something that will be included? This is something Zest will unlikely support in the near future. Since later / remind are no longer valid resolutions, I am going to close this as wontfix. If this is really important, please re-open and I will happily accept patches. :)
Bug.WithOutStack: I would like support for fisheye and bifocal lenses like prefuse provides. Is this slated as something that will be included? This is something Zest will unlikely support in the near future. Since later / remind are no longer valid resolutions, I am going to close this as wontfix. If this is really important, please re-open and I will happily accept patches. :)

Bug.Summery: SWT Table performance as a Worksheet

Lines.Line: 1) If you run with the XP manifest, the flashing will go away. See
2) The SWT table is the Windows ListView32 control that is used throughout
Windows. Can you confirm that the SWT table is flashing while other tables on
the desktop (says the table of files in the Explorer) do not? That would be
3) There may be other reasons that the SWT table will not cut it as a
Worksheet for you. For example, it is not a spreadsheet control, so it
doesn't have cell selection (although this can be achieved with the
TableCursor class). Regardless, I am still interested in fixing any flashing
that SWT may have introduced in the native control.

Bug.Summery: Expose MATCH operator in filter builders
Bug.WithStack: Data Engine has added a new conditional operator, MATCH, (see related bugzilla 115940). This operator should be exposed in filter editors for data set and table/list. That operator need add by model. It's transparent to GUI code. check the new operator & add it in ROM. added 'MATCH' operator in ROM Verified in build 20051219 "Match" has been added into ROM
Bug.WithOutStack: Data Engine has added a new conditional operator, MATCH, (see related bugzilla 115940). This operator should be exposed in filter editors for data set and table/list. That operator need add by model. It's transparent to GUI code. check the new operator & add it in ROM. added 'MATCH' operator in ROM Verified in build 20051219 "Match" has been added into ROM

Bug.Summery: Busy emebedded help search
Bug.WithStack:
The new embedded help has some nice features, but I find the search view a bit too much in terms of screen clutter. Icons are repetitive and all over the page (as the titles wrap).Basically, you have 3 icons per topic. I think you could just have one, the one that opens the topic in external browser. I will attach a screenshot Created attachment 30112 busy search view
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 114610 ***

actual result: error message shows up
expected result: nested aggregation is not supported yet The direct nested aggregate is supported now. verified in build 20051122

description: nested aggregation is not supported yet
steps to reproduce: create a nested aggregation for a filter expression and run it
actual result: error message shows up
expected result: nested aggregation is not supported yet The direct nested aggregate is supported now. verified in build 20051122

Bug.Summery: The type of output parameter defined in Sybase is displyaed as "unknown".

Lines.Line: 1. Define an output parameter in Sybase stored procedure.
2. Call this procedure in BIRT and view parameter type.
3. It is displayed as "unknown" instead of "output".
It's a driver-related bug which has been fixed in jtds1.1.
Users who are still using jtds0.9 might want to consider using a new version of jtds or other drivers to resolve this problem.
Please notice the version exchange will take effect after restarting BIRT application.

Bug.WithStack:

Steps to reproduce: 1. Define an output parameter in Sybase stored procedure. 2. Call this procedure in BIRT and view parameter type. 3. It is displayed as "unknown" instead of "output". It's a driver-related bug which has been fixed in jtds1.1. Users who are still using jtds0.9 might want to consider using a new version of jtds or other drivers to resolve this problem. Bug.Summery: External JARs not copied to correct module folder in deployable
Bug.WithStack:
Steps to reproduce
* start new workspace * define tomcat 5.5 runtime and server * create dynamic webapp project "war" and add it to the server * add JUNIT_HOME/junit.jar to war's Web Libraries * create server T that classes from junit.jar (see servlet source below) * start tomcat server and try to access localhost:8080/war/T
Problem: there is no junit.jar in .metadata/.../tmp0/webapps/war/WEB-INF/lib and requests to the servlet fail with NoClassDefFoundError
Servlet source
package t; import java.io.IOException; import javax.servlet.ServletException; import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest; import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse; import junit.framework.TestSuite; public class T extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet implements javax.servlet.Servlet { protected void doGet(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws ServletException, IOException { TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(); response.getWriter().println(suite.getName()); } } Tim,
SAS Institute's use of WTP in what we are building on top of Eclipse and WTP is severly impacted by this bug. Thus, I would like to see its serverity increased to at least major, if not critial. Since 116895 is now fixed, these jars will at least appear in an exported war. I'll start investigating to see what I can figure out.
Larry Added to Adopter Hot List and set priority to P2. Please fix by RC2. This is a significant regression from WTP 1.0M6 for all the folks who are using Maven (see bug #87474). Would re-opening that Major bug help highlight the importance of this regression? Larry Isaacs says this can be defered to 1.0.1 from SAS's pov. Hi Ron, Sorry, this one is going to be deferred post 1.0. I would like to get it completed in 1.0.1, but there is some significant change that needs to happen to support this, so that is not guaranteed until Larry or I have a chance to investigate. There is no point reopening 87474 since this is being handled in a much different manner in the 1.0 stream, so please keep us honest and add any comments to this bug. Targetted to 1.0.1. This really sounds like a show stopper for me, and a grave regression... why postponing it to 1.0.1? This means that projects successfully working with wtp R7 will not work anymore after a migration without any warning (just spent a lot of time in understanding why my projects were not properly migrated and why they didn't work). I know it's pretty late in the 1.0 game, but IHMO leaving this open in 1.0 will gain a lot of negative feedback from users trying to migrate from R7 and from maven users (which now can setup their projects automatically with the maven eclipse/wtp plugin, but which will never be able to run their projects with wtp 1.0)... Trying not to point fingers, this feature was added in 0.7 without figuring out how it would be handled in the future and whether it could actually be supported in the long run. When the framework switched back to the server team, we weren't aware of this new feature until recently. I definitely want to support this, but the changes are too big and will affect several server types, so it can't be considered for 1.0. We'll be looking at ways to support this consistently as soon as the code stream opens up again. *** Bug 120468 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 121206 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 121485 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 121724 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 121264 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 123591 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Just a comment about bug #123591 , marked as a duplicate: in M200601102004 external jars totally block publishing of a project.
Var references seems now to be interpreted as simple (and invalid) filesystem paths and this causes a blocking error during publishing. While waiting for external jars to be handled correctly, can't we at least ignore them as before so that manualy copying jars could be used as a workaround?
There is still no junit test with projects with external jars... could at least an external jar reference be added to an existing unit test in order to assure that this will not totally break publishing in future? Tested on this week's M-build with both jst.j2ee and my latest changes. Fixed a bug in the publish behaviour (released) and found a couple issues remaining in jst.j2ee: * There is no way to remove an external jar from the properties page. Unchecking it doesn't apply. * The external jar shows up in the root of a returned Web module although the WEB-INF/lib is correct in the path. It should really be contained within the correct ModuleFolder. Where it is causes problems for servers that create folders as it goes instead of checking on each file. Ok, the J2EE deployables are fixed to return the module resource for the external jar under the appropriate module folder. This is released for the 1/31/06 WTP 1.0.1 and 1.5 builds.
However, this exposes a problem in the generic server which will be tracked using 125721. This needs to be fixed in WTP 1.0.1
Also, the last comment by Tim about the removal of the external jar not working, will be tracked using 125722. This will be fixed in WTP 1.5.
Please follow these new bugs if interested. I'm going to mark this bug as complete. John,
Since I requested this bug to be added to the hot list, and it isn't working for me following the "Steps to reproduce", I would like to request that it be reopened. With up to the minute WTP 1.0.1 code, following those steps I get:
Publishing failed Error copying file to C:\Java\Eclipse\311WTP101ADSTest\Workspaces\runtime-EclipseApplication\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\TestWebApp: Error deleting C:\Java\Eclipse\311WTP101ADSTest\Workspaces\runtime-EclipseApplication\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\TestWebApp
To fix, I use the attached patch. I'm going to need this in WTP 1.0.1 if SAS Institute is going to be able to use WTP 1.0.1. Thanks.
Larry Created attachment 33820 Patch to org.eclipse.jst.server.core.PublishUtil to correct what may be a typo Reassigning to Tim to look at Larry's patch. Sorry, Larry, forgot to hit 'commit' on your earlier patch. It was sitting in my workspace all ready to go. :)
This change has been checked into HEAD. I can't release right now because of an 'anonymous CVS lock' but I'll make sure it is released for the 1.0.1 M build this week. Fix released for this week's M-build. I can confirm this is working for at least the Tomcat servers in the M200602070438 build. This does not fully work. When the jars from a dependent project are deployed, a hard-coded "C:\" is prefixed. eg:
<dependent-module deploy-path="/WEB-INF/lib" handle="module:/classpath/lib//ot-thirdparty/lib/ehcache/ehcache-1.1.jar"> <dependency-type>uses</dependency-type> </dependent-module>
Yields the following error:
Publishing failed Error reading file C:\ot-thirdparty\lib\ehcache\ehcache-1.1.jar
In my environment, the workpace and projects are not on "C:\" Re: comment #24 - this is tracked by bug 128403. The current support works for external jars bug not jars within workspace projects. I want to let everyone know that this problem reappeared in WTP 1.5. Just tried "steps to reproduce" from original problem description with 1.5M6 and got exactly the same ClassNotFoundError as in 1.0. Is this something we need to fix in 1.0.2? If not, can we update the target? I have not extensively tested 1.0.2 builds, but 1.0.2RC2 does not seem to have this problem. +1 to the comment below, the latests builds since 1.5M6 again exhibit this issue. Is there an ETA on the fix?
(In reply to comment #26) > I want to let everyone know that this problem reappeared in WTP 1.5. Just tried > "steps to reproduce" from original problem description with 1.5M6 and got > exactly the same ClassNotFoundError as in 1.0. > please see https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=137957 verified closing verified defect

Unchecking it doesn't apply. * The external jar shows up in the root of a returned Web module although the WEB-INF/lib is correct in the path. It should really be contained within the correct ModuleFolder. Where it is causes problems for servers that create folders as it goes instead of checking on each file. Ok, the J2EE deployables are fixed to return the module resource for the external jar under the appropriate module folder. This is released for the 1/31/06 WTP 1.0.1 and 1.5 builds.
However, this exposes a problem in the generic server which will be tracked using 125721. This needs to be fixed in WTP 1.0.1
Also, the last comment by Tim about the removal of the external jar not working, will be tracked using 125722. This will be fixed in WTP 1.5.
Please follow these new bugs if interested. I'm going to mark this bug as complete. John,
Since I requested this bug to be added to the hot list, and it isn't working for me following the "Steps to reproduce", I would like to request that it be reopened. With up to the minute WTP 1.0.1 code, following those steps I get:
Publishing failed Error copying file to C:\Java\Eclipse\311WTP101ADSTest\Workspaces\runtime-EclipseApplication\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\TestWebApp: Error deleting C:\Java\Eclipse\311WTP101ADSTest\Workspaces\runtime-EclipseApplication\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\TestWebApp
To fix, I use the attached patch. I'm going to need this in WTP 1.0.1 if SAS Institute is going to be able to use WTP 1.0.1. Thanks.
Larry Created attachment 33820 Patch to org.eclipse.jst.server.core.PublishUtil to correct what may be a typo Reassigning to Tim to look at Larry's patch. Sorry, Larry, forgot to hit 'commit' on your earlier patch. It was sitting in my workspace all ready to go. :)
This change has been checked into HEAD. I can't release right now because of an 'anonymous CVS lock' but I'll make sure it is released for the 1.0.1 M build this week. Fix released for this week's M-build. I can confirm this is working for at least the Tomcat servers in the M200602070438 build. This does not fully work. When the jars from a dependent project are deployed, a hard-coded "C:\" is prefixed. eg:
<dependent-module deploy-path="/WEB-INF/lib" handle="module:/classpath/lib//ot-thirdparty/lib/ehcache/ehcache-1.1.jar"> <dependency-type>uses</dependency-type> </dependent-module>
Yields the following error:
Publishing failed Error reading file C:\ot-thirdparty\lib\ehcache\ehcache-1.1.jar
In my environment, the workpace and projects are not on "C:\" Re: comment #24 - this is tracked by bug 128403. The current support works for external jars bug not jars within workspace projects. I want to let everyone know that this problem reappeared in WTP 1.5. Just tried "steps to reproduce" from original problem description with 1.5M6 and got exactly the same ClassNotFoundError as in 1.0. Is this something we need to fix in 1.0.2? If not, can we update the target? I have not extensively tested 1.0.2 builds, but 1.0.2RC2 does not seem to have this problem. +1 to the comment below, the latests builds since 1.5M6 again exhibit this issue. Is there an ETA on the fix?
(In reply to comment #26) > I want to let everyone know that this problem reappeared in WTP 1.5. Just tried > "steps to reproduce" from original problem description with 1.5M6 and got > exactly the same ClassNotFoundError as in 1.0. > please see https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=137957 verified closing verified defect

Bug.Summery: [website] suggest we add "webtools search" to many of our pages.
Bug.WithStack:
I think we should take advantage of this eclipse.org service, as mentioned in committers newsletter from webmaster.
3. Website search =================
Did you know you can use our search engine on your project website to search your project's resources specifically? Here's a sample form (also in the Committer Tools "How do I?" section):
<form method="get" action="/search/search.cgi"> <input type="hidden" name="ul" value="/ajdt" /> <input type="hidden" name="wf" value="574a74" /> <input type="text" name="q" value="" /> <input type="submit" value="Search AJDT!" /> </form>
The above form will restrict search to any of our websites that have /ajdt in the URL. See https://dev.eclipse.org/committers/help/howdoi.php#website.search for more info. I agree and was planning on doing this after we finish up for 1.0. Thanks for opening the bug. Website search is included in the Phoenix site structure. This request should be filled once the still forming website team migrates the website. Please forward this defect to Bob Frasor, as appropriate. This appears fixed with the Phoenix conversion.
Closing

Bug.Summery: Library include should store relative path.

Lines.Line: - i see that hte report design stores absolute path, we need to save relative
We can't fix this becuase java URL.relative method can parse that case to
Do you knwo some other way?
- this bug needs to be fixed. If this cannot be done for M3, this definitely
needs to be done for BIRT 2.0 RC
- its a show stopper for BIRT 2.0
- will work with Qiangsheng on this issue.

Bug.WithStack:
When a library included in a report design, the BIRT designer should generate the relative path, and save relative path.
Example - $project/test contains my report design. - now include a library from $project/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary. - i see that hte report design stores absolute path, we need to save relative path.
<property name="fileName">/E:/birt/sampleReports/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary</property> <property name="namespace">lib1</property> It stores relative path for the case below - $project/test/test.rptdesign - $project/test/lib/lib1.rptlibrary. We can't fix this becuase java URL.relative method can parse that case to relative path. Do you knwo some other way?
- this bug needs to be fixed. If this cannot be done for M3, this definitely needs to be done for BIRT 2.0 RC - its a show stopper for BIRT 2.0 - will work with Qiangsheng on this issue.
We current use java URI to parse relative. I don't think GUI team have resouce to write a class to parse relative path. It's better to let API team to provide such kind of code. Model team have provided two methods in URIUtil.java: getRelativePath and resolveAbsolutePath. Please note these methods do not check whether the file is existed or not.
See sources for details.
The UI changes need to be done to use the model provided utility Use URIUtil to parse relative path. Verified in build 20051125.
Bug.WithOutStack:
When a library included in a report design, the BIRT designer should generate the relative path, and save relative path.
Example - $project/test contains my report design. - now include a library from $project/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary. - i see that hte report design stores absolute path, we need to save relative path.
<property name="fileName">/E:/birt/sampleReports/otherlib/lib1.rptlibrary</property> <property name="namespace">lib1</property> It stores relative path for the case below - $project/test/test.rptdesign - $project/test/lib/lib1.rptlibrary. We can't fix this becuase java URL.relative method can parse that case to relative path. Do you knwo some other way?
- this bug needs to be fixed. If this cannot be done for M3, this definitely needs to be done for BIRT 2.0 RC - its a show stopper for BIRT 2.0 - will work with Qiangsheng on this issue.
We current use java URI to parse relative. I don't think GUI team have resouce to write a class to parse relative path. It's better to let API team to provide such kind of code. Model team have provided two methods in URIUtil.java: getRelativePath and resolveAbsolutePath. Please note these methods do not check whether the file is existed or not.
See sources for details.
The UI changes need to be done to use the model provided utility Use URIUtil to parse relative path. Verified in build 20051125.

Bug.Summery: Can not trigger to enable "use library..." in the top menu bar

Lines.Line: 1.New a report design, and new a report library. In the library, pull in a text
2.In the Navigator view, click on the report design file. Then click "Element"
in the top menu, you will find the "Use library.." is disabled. At the same
time, "Import CSS Style.." is disabled too.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: It seems that can not trigger to enable "use library..." in the top menu bar.
Steps to reproduce: 1.New a report design, and new a report library. In the library, pull in a text element to the report item. 2.In the Navigator view, click on the report design file. Then click "Element" in the top menu, you will find the "Use library.." is disabled. At the same time, "Import CSS Style.." is disabled too.
Expect result: If user select on the report design file, "Use library..." and "Import Css Style..." should be enabled for user to do the actions. These two actions only work for designer. The navigator view is not a part of Birt. In the Library explorer view, if select on one library file, the "use library.." on the top menu should be enabled. 1. In lib exploer, user can use context menu to use lib. 2. That's eclipse limitatio to associate action with editor. This is a feature need big effects but don't get really result. Defer to future. If the top menu bar actions are associated with editor not the lib explorer view, and it is a Eclipse convention/behvaior, we do not want to change it.
Resolve this as won't fix? Yes, it is a Eclipse convention/behvaior

Bug.Summery: Chart default width and height are small
Bug.WithStack:
Chart default width and height are small.
Steps: 1.Create a bar chart 2.View the layout
Actual Results: 1.Width and height are small We've decided to change the default size of the chart, the original one being far too big. you should be able to put two charts side by side in a 2-column grid in a report without resizing them. So the chart width is about half of the width of the report.
Also we removed the default titles for X Axis, Y axis, which aren't always used. cancel
Bug.WithOutStack:
Chart default width and height are small.
Steps: 1.Create a bar chart 2.View the layout
Actual Results: 1.Width and height are small We've decided to change the default size of the chart, the original one being far too big. you should be able to put two charts side by side in a 2-column grid in a report without resizing them. So the chart width is about half of the width of the report.
Also we removed the default titles for X Axis, Y axis, which aren't always used. cancel

Bug.Summery: Struts JSP coding problem.
Bug.WithStack:
When I coding Struts(version: 1.2.4) JSP, I need to copy the tag libary files (*.tld) to the WEB-INF folder. But with this version, I should not need to do such action.
When I have not copy the tag libary files to the WEB-INF folder, all the Struts tag will be reverse like "<lmth", and other tags character will change colour like black or grey. When I delete a character, a NullPointerException will show, paste also show such exception.
My colleague do not need to copy the tag libary files to WEB-INF folder, they use the universal uri like "http://struts.apache.org/tags-html" will be fine.
My cooleague is using Windows 2000, and my OS is Windows XP, will it cause such bug? I can guess at some possible factors, especially for the "backwards typing" you are seeing: "<lmth". We found, and I think fixed in 0.71 version. Have you tried that small upgrade? This backwards typing was releated to exceptions that occurred, at the worst time, thus messing up the precise timing on the UI tread. Our fix was to catch and handle the exceptions elsewhere, so wouldn't impact typing.
Plus, there were/are problem finding the tag libs, which I think has been fixed some in M8, and more in M9.
Windows XP vs. 2000 would not be a factor. There could also be issues if one is connected to the internet and the other note?
So, please try upgrading to 071 if you haven't yet, as a first step, and see if that helps. I can't solve the problem by upgrade the web tool to 0.7.1 version, in 0.7.1 version, the tag character will not type backwardly, but all of the tag including standard html tag and Struts tag can not be identify by the Eclipse.
Please notes that my workstation and my colleague's workstation also have connect to the internet, and they do not need to copy the tag library files to the project folder and they are use the universal uri to use the tag library directly. (In reply to comment #1) > When I coding Struts(version: 1.2.4) JSP, I need to copy the tag libary files > (*.tld) to the WEB-INF folder. But with this version, I should not need to do > such action. ... > My colleague do not need to copy the tag libary files to WEB-INF folder, they > use the universal uri like "http://struts.apache.org/tags-html" will be fine.
If the Struts *jar* files aren't located within the project itself, your colleague may have it installed somewhere so that it still appears on the project's build path (does he see listed it in the Project Explorer. If that's the case, then both WTP and most servers will be able to find it. Please reopen if it is still not working, but the jar files need to either be in the project or preferably somewhere on the Java Build Path. The universal URI only works when the jars are local.

Bug.Summery: If the first item is a template item in editor, preview doesn't work.

Lines.Line: 1. Add a label in a template file.
2. Add another same label and transfer it to a template item.
3. Preview and two labels are displayed.
4. Change two labels order and let the template is placed before the report
5. Preview and find that nothing is displayed.
It be. The template item will repeat the last item before it. Not only Label does so, but also the Text.
Report item should be displayed when previewed.
When the template item is the first item, it will cause a exception. It is handled as a severe error. Repaired the bug by handled the exception as a warning.

Bug.WithStack:
Description: If the first item is a template item in editor, preview doesn't work.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a label in a template file. 2. Add another same label and transfer it to a template item. 3. Preview and two labels are displayed. 4. Change two labels order and let the template is placed before the report item. 5. Preview and find that nothing is displayed. It be. The template item will repeat the last item before it. Not only Label does so, but also the Text. Report item should be displayed when previewed. When the template item is the first item, it will cause a exception. It is handled as a severe error. Repaired the bug by handled the exception as a warning. Verified in build 20051125.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Description: If the first item is a template item in editor, preview doesn't work.
Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a label in a template file. 2. Add another same label and transfer it to a template item. 3. Preview and two labels are displayed. 4. Change two labels order and let the template is placed before the report item. 5. Preview and find that nothing is displayed. It be. The template item will repeat the last item before it. Not only Label does so, but also the Text. Report item should be displayed when previewed. When the template item is the first item, it will cause a exception. It is handled as a severe error. Repaired the bug by handled the exception as a warning. Verified in build 20051125.

Bug.Summery: Provide option in gmfgen model for the links to align direction in view with direction in model
Bug.WithStack: When link representation (view) is directed (for example it has distinct source and target decorations) and it is possible to create link in reverse direction (from target to source) link direction in view and model will differ. This may be desirable or not; so there should be an option for this.
